text: The 1901–02 international cricket season was from September 1901 to April 1902. ==Season overview== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="7" |International tours |- ! rowspan="2" |Start date ! rowspan="2" |Home team ! rowspan="2" |Away team ! colspan="4" |Results [Matches] |- !Test !ODI !FC !LA |- | | | |4–1 [5] |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |- | | | |; style="text-align:center"| — |; style="text-align:center"| — |2–1 [3] |; style="text-align:center"| — |} ==December== === England in Australia === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|The Ashes Test series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Test 65 || 13–16 December || Joe Darling || Archie MacLaren || Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney || by an innings and 124 runs |- | Test 66 || 1–4 January || Joe Darling || Archie MacLaren || Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne || by 229 runs |- | Test 67 || 17–23 January || Joe Darling || Archie MacLaren || Adelaide Oval, Adelaide || by 4 wickets |- | Test 68 || 14–18 February || Hugh Trumble || Archie MacLaren || Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney || by 7 wickets |- | Test 69 || 28 Feb–4 March || Hugh Trumble || Archie MacLaren || Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne || by 32 runs |} ==January== === England in the West Indies === {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="9"|First-class Series |- ! No. ! Date ! Home captain ! Away captain ! Venue ! Result |- | Match 1 || 29–30 January || Harold Austin || Richard Bennett || Kensington Oval, Bridgetown || by an innings and 4 runs |- | Match 2 || 31 Mar–4 April || Bertie Harragin || Richard Bennett || Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain || by 111 runs |- | Match 3 || 4–7 April || Clement King || Richard Bennett || Bourda, Georgetown || Bennett's XI by an innings and 330 runs |} ==References== Category:International cricket competitions by season Category:1901 in cricket Category:1902 in cricket
title: International cricket in 1901–02
